Lew stressed the importance of keeping the production of these kits in the
hands of one person or a group of utilization committee members* This sug¬
gestion also was made by several others* The need seems to be to have some
mechanism to make sure that when the project is completed it will all fit together
into some kind of a total approach*
Jim Fellows* comments reemphasized what many others had said* He felt that our
categories were too broad and cumbersome and we should narrow onto more specific
activities•
Marguerite Flemming responded by sending an outline of plans for a "Let's Find
Out'* kit. She suggested the need for a special national commnttee meeting with
plenty of material to look at and evaluate. In line with our suggested meeting
at the IFRT in Columbus, she felt that we should solicit as much material from
stations as possible with an eye towards screening this material and laying out
an overall plan.
A good many of you indicated your preference for some of the kit ideas expressed
in the project outline dated January 26th. The concensus was that ideas 1, 2,
3, 7, 8, ? and 10 were the most feasible. Numbers 1 and 8 seemed to be the most
urgent. This is encouraging since we can start on the file of sample kinescopes
or tape recordings immediately. All of you are familiar with some school
broadcast and could make nominations of series that should be represented in
this sample file. If you would send me their titles along with the name of the
person to be contacted, I will undertake to get a preview copy for our May
meeting in Columbus.
From all of the above comments I think you can see we have our hands full. The
project definitely needs to be put into proper focus. We should be impressed
with the amount of interest this project has created. Some of the comments
indicated that there needed to be more communication between committee members.
This memo is an attempt at this communication. To facilitate unilateral
exploration of the subject, I will include a list of the committee membership
as I know it.
We need to spend some time on this project in Columbus. In my previous letter I
asked how many would be able to meet on May 3rd and, while I didn't hear
from everyone, those that I did hear from indicated they would be available. To
the rest of you, check over your calendar and see if you can’t clear May 3rd.
We really need a long uninterrupted session to deal with the loose ends of this
project.
